Department Overview
 
Barclays moves, lends, invests and protects money for customers and clients worldwide.  With over 300 years of history and expertise in banking, we operate in over 50 countries and employ over 140,000 people.
We provide large corporate, government and institutional clients with a full spectrum of solutions to their strategic advisory, financing and risk management needs. Our clients also benefit from access to the breadth of expertise across Barclays.  We’re one of the largest financial services providers in the world, and are also engaged in retail banking, credit cards, corporate banking, and wealth and investment management.
For further information about Barclays, please visit our website www.barclays.com.
It is the policy of Barclays to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, creed, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other basis protected by law.
 
Operations and Cross Product Technology (OCPT) is a global team responsible for development and support of cross asset, post trade functions and processes. A critical function for the operation of the bank, OCPT provides technology solutions across all asset classes for Operations (Middle Office and Back Office) and Product Control. OCPT also has a remit across the investment bank for Enterprise Architecture and for Reference Data.

Finance IT develops applications and provides IT support to the bank’s Financial Control function. It's a global function, covering many different sites, across all business lines. The main functional areas covered are:
·         P&L and balance sheet reporting to Product Control and Finance.
·         MI reporting to senior management.
·         Adjustment and Provisioning functionality.
·         Book static and hierarchy maintenance.
The Finance IT team is composed of 80+ staff spread over three continents (Europe, Asia and US)


Main Function
The MOTIF project is building a Global Operations and Finance Platform that standardises and integrates the daily and the monthly processes, providing a common view and query on the underlying data. The project implements a message based service oriented architecture hosted on a high performance computing grid.
The role is that of Accounting Service Lead tasked with the establishing the MOTIF Accounting capability as a best-of-breed Sub-Ledger.
The Service Lead is responsible for both the design and delivery of the Accounting Service and ancillary functions. They would be responsible for leading and developing the team to realize the Service vision and goals.
The ideal candidate would have both strong technical and business skills; the candidate would act both as a technical authority as well as have an extensive knowledge of Ledger systems, accounting processes and the activities undertaken by Finance and Operations functions.


Main Duties
Analysis and Design:
Work with business stakeholders and analysts to understand and validate the Business and Functional Requirements.
Own the Functional and Technical Design of the Accounting Service and lead the efforts to incorporate new functionality and business process.
Communicate the technical service contract, interface and behaviour to Service Owners and obtain specification sign-off.
Code:
Lead the development of the Java components. This will include hands-on Java development.
Act as the Technical Authority for the team.
Look to innovate to provide improvements in coding efficiency or quality.
Performance tuning of software to ensure acceptable application performance.
Integrate with and support a Model Driven Architecture (MDA) paradigm implemented by the Motif programme to enforce the explicit and ongoing relationship between the model and the code-base.
Quality Assurance:
Continuously drive improvements to the Build process to deliver efficiencies, increased quality, simplification, etc.
Conducting peer reviews and providing constructive feedback.
Contribute to and develop best practice documentation templates and methods to capture the resulting process models to predefined company and department standards.
Guiding Technical documentation through review and sign-off processes as part of the technical-leadership team.
Testing:
Assist in preparation of unit tests for all delivered code.
Execution of unit test cases and documentation of results.
Providing support during QA and UAT test phases.
        Diagnosis and resolution of defects found during QA and UAT test phases.
 Identify and document alternate success and failure test scenarios
Implementation:
Create development plan and deliver to that plan.
Provide regular status updates and management reports.
Motivate and support the team to achieve deadlines.
Training and knowledge transfer to support team.
Post-Implementation:
Point of contact for support team, investigating and resolving post-release issues found in production.
Assist with problem management and root cause determination
         Builds standard operating procedures to support MOTIF project


Person Requirements
Qualifications /education:
Essential: Degree
Preferred:
Numerate degree (e.g. engineering, maths, economics)
Good university and good academic grades
Experience required:
Essential:An investment banking/finance background.
Experience in working on a major IT project using Java. Experience of development within an object based distributed architecture.
Experience of test driven development.
Experience working with source code control tools, mainly Perforce and/or ClearCase.
 
Preferred:Experience of database development using Oracle (minimum 10g R2).
Esperience of working on a sub-ledger application.
Experience of Model Driven Architecture
Experience of using UML to express design intent.

Skills and knowledge: Essential:
Knowledge of software development ‘best practices’ and software development life cycle
Strong Java skills, both design and development.
Knowledge of software configuration management and version control.
Team player, strong analysis skills
Excellent problem analysis skills
Ability to multitask
Strong analytical and logical skills
The ability to resolve issues in a high-pressure environment.
 

Preferred:
Knowledge of Finance / Back Office accounting processes in an investment banking environment.
Knowledge of rules engine concepts.
Knowledge of Business Process Modelling (BPM), ideally using Enterprise Architect.
Strong UML knowledge.
 
Candidate Profile: Essential:
An effective communicator. Should have excellent written and verbal English language skills
Able to quickly learn and adapt
Able to work well with IT developers in multiple locations.
A thorough approach to work.
Enthusiastic and willing to learn.
Flexible in terms of working hours/schedule – especially during the key Build Phase of the project
